tasks.title: Set heating on arrival

images.alt: Gas bottle valve in open position
images.caption: Step 2: Open the gas bottle valve - turn anti-clockwise

images.alt: Truma control panel showing heating mode selection
images.caption: Step 3: Select heating mode on the Truma panel

images.alt: Truma panel temperature controls
images.caption: Step 4: Use +/- buttons to set desired temperature

steps: Connect to mains hook-up if available, or ensure leisure battery is charged
Open the gas bottle valve (located in the gas locker)
On the Truma control panel, select your heating mode (gas, electric, or mixed)
Set your desired temperature using the +/- controls
Wait for the system to ignite (you should hear the fan start)
Adjust temperature as needed once the vehicle begins to warm
safety_notes: Ensure roof vents are not blocked by snow or debris
Never run gas heating during refuelling
Allow 15-20 minutes for the vehicle to reach temperature

tasks.title: Lower the drop-down bed

images.alt: Drop-down bed in raised position above the cab
images.caption: Starting position: bed raised and secured above cab

images.alt: Bed control switch mounted on wall
images.caption: Step 4: Press and hold the down button on the control switch

images.alt: Drop-down bed fully lowered ready for sleeping
images.caption: Bed lowered to sleeping position

steps: Clear the area below the bed of any obstructions
Ensure no one is standing in the cab area
Locate the bed control switch (typically near the bed or on the wall)
Press and hold the 'down' button
Guide the bed down gently if needed
Release the button when the bed reaches the desired height
Check the bed is stable before use
safety_notes: Never lower the bed while driving
Keep fingers clear of the mechanism during operation
Do not exceed the bed's weight limit

tasks.title: Winterise the water system

images.alt: Water pump switch on control panel
images.caption: Step 1: Turn off the water pump at the control panel

images.alt: Fresh water tank drain valve underneath vehicle
images.caption: Step 4: Fresh water tank drain valve location

images.alt: Waste water drain valve
images.caption: Step 8: Drain the waste water tank completely

steps: Turn off the water pump at the control panel
Open all taps (hot and cold) including shower
Open the drain valve on the fresh water tank (usually underneath the vehicle)
Open the drain valve on the water heater (refer to Truma manual for location)
Flush the toilet and hold flush until water stops
Leave all taps in the open position
Consider using approved water system antifreeze for added protection
Drain the waste water tank completely
safety_notes: Water left in the system can freeze and cause serious damage
Check all drain points are fully open
If using antifreeze, ensure it is safe for drinking water systems

tasks.title: Connect to mains hook-up

images.alt: Uncoiled mains hook-up cable
images.caption: Step 2: Fully uncoil the mains cable before use

images.alt: Vehicle external mains inlet socket
images.caption: Step 3: Connect to the vehicle's external inlet FIRST

images.alt: Campsite electrical bollard
images.caption: Step 4: Then connect to the campsite bollard

steps: Ensure the vehicle's main switch is off
Uncoil the mains cable completely to prevent overheating
Connect the cable to the vehicle's external inlet first
Then connect the other end to the campsite bollard
Switch on at the bollard
Check the control panel confirms mains connection
The battery charger will begin charging automatically
safety_notes: Always connect to vehicle first, then to mains supply
When disconnecting, reverse the order (mains first, then vehicle)
Never use damaged or wet cables
Use only approved camping cables rated for outdoor use

tasks.title: Fill the fresh water tank

images.alt: Fresh water filler cap on exterior of vehicle
images.caption: Step 1: Locate the fresh water filler cap on the exterior

images.alt: Blue drinking water approved hose
images.caption: Step 3: Use only approved drinking water hoses

images.alt: Control panel showing tank level indicator
images.caption: Step 5: Watch the tank level on the control panel

steps: Locate the fresh water filler cap (usually on the vehicle exterior)
Remove the cap and check the seal is clean
Connect your drinking water hose
Turn on the water supply slowly
Watch the tank level indicator on the control panel
Stop filling when the indicator shows full (do not overfill)
Replace and secure the filler cap
Run the tap briefly to prime the system if needed
safety_notes: Use only hoses approved for drinking water
Do not use water from unknown sources
If the vehicle has been unused, flush the system before drinking

images.alt: Drop-down bed fully raised and secured
images.caption: Step 1: Ensure drop-down bed is FULLY raised

images.alt: Cupboard doors with secure latches
images.caption: Step 2: Check all cupboard doors are latched

images.alt: Roof vent in closed position
images.caption: Step 4: All roof vents and windows must be closed

images.alt: External storage locker locked
images.caption: Step 8: Verify all exterior lockers are locked

steps: Raise and secure the drop-down bed fully
Secure all loose items and close all cupboards
Check the fridge is set to 12V or switched off
Close and lock all roof vents and windows
Retract the step if manual (automatic steps retract when door closes)
Disconnect and stow the mains cable
Turn off the gas at the bottle
Check exterior lockers are locked
Ensure TV aerial is lowered if applicable
Check tyre pressures and lights
Adjust mirrors and check reversing camera
safety_notes: Never drive with the drop-down bed lowered
Ensure all passengers are seated with seatbelts fastened
Check your route for height and weight restrictions

tasks.title: Troubleshoot: No water from taps

images.alt: Control panel showing water tank level
images.caption: Step 1: Check the water tank level indicator

images.alt: 12V fuse box with pump fuse location
images.caption: Step 3: Check the pump fuse in the electrical panel

images.alt: Inline water filter location
images.caption: Step 6: Check the water filter if fitted

steps: Check the water tank level indicator - refill if empty
Verify the water pump is switched on at the control panel
Check the pump fuse in the electrical panel
Listen for the pump running when you open a tap
If pump runs but no water, check for airlocks (open taps in sequence)
Inspect the water filter if fitted - it may be blocked
Check for frozen pipes in cold weather
If problem persists, the pump may need professional attention
safety_notes: Do not run the pump for extended periods when dry
If you smell burning or see sparks, turn off immediately

tasks.title: Troubleshoot: Heating not working

images.alt: Gas bottle valve in gas locker
images.caption: Step 1: Check gas bottle is not empty and valve is open

images.alt: Truma control panel showing error codes
images.caption: Step 2: Check for error codes on the Truma panel

images.alt: Heating exhaust vent on exterior of vehicle
images.caption: Step 7: Check the exhaust vent is not blocked

steps: Check the gas bottle is not empty and valve is open
Verify the control panel is set correctly and showing no error codes
Ensure mains power is connected if using electric heating
Check the relevant fuses in the electrical panel
For gas operation, the system may need bleeding after gas bottle change
Attempt to reset by turning the heating off and on again
Check the exhaust vent outside is not blocked
Consult Truma error codes if displayed on the panel
safety_notes: If you smell gas, turn off immediately and ventilate
Do not attempt to repair gas components yourself
Contact a qualified technician for persistent issues

tasks.title: Empty the waste water tank

images.alt: Waste water drain valve location underneath vehicle
images.caption: Step 2: Waste tank drain valve - usually underneath, near middle

images.alt: Waste valve in open position
images.caption: Step 4: Open the waste tank valve fully

steps: Position the vehicle over a designated waste water drain point
Locate the waste tank drain valve (usually underneath, near the middle)
Place a container underneath if needed, or ensure alignment with drain
Open the waste tank valve fully
Wait for the tank to drain completely
Close the valve securely
Rinse the drain area if facilities permit
safety_notes: Only empty at designated disposal points
Never empty onto the ground or into storm drains
Wash hands thoroughly after handling waste water

tasks.title: Troubleshoot: 12V electrical fault

images.alt: Main battery disconnect switch
images.caption: Step 1: Check the main battery disconnect switch is ON

images.alt: 12V fuse box location and layout
images.caption: Step 3: Fuse box location - check for blown fuses

images.alt: Leisure battery terminal connections
images.caption: Step 7: Check battery terminals are clean and tight

steps: Check the main battery disconnect switch is on
Verify leisure battery charge level on the control panel
Locate the fuse box (usually near the control panel or under a seat)
Check and replace any blown fuses with correct rating
If connected to mains, check the charger is working
Test individual circuits to isolate the problem
Check battery terminal connections are clean and tight
If battery repeatedly goes flat, it may need replacement
safety_notes: Always replace fuses with the correct amp rating
Do not attempt to repair or modify the electrical system
Disconnect battery before working on electrical components
